rename.from: Adding a resources:ram:1234 tag to a test doesn't work and causes a crash
rename.to: Adding a `resources:ram:1234` tag to a test doesn't work and causes a crash

body:
I believe the tag is `resources:memory:1234`, which seems to be working correctly for me.

I wonder if it is worth having a special mapping of the resource name `ram` and `memory`, since the old flag was `--local_ram_resources=1234`, but the new way will be `--local_resources=memory=1234`.  Seems like a lot of people are going to get bitten by this.

Perhaps a better solution:
Using a `resources:` tag for an unknown resource should display a calm error message and exit, instead of crashing the server process.  The error message should include the available resources, so it would be quite obvious that `memory` is one of the options.
We would welcome an external contribution here.

issue.title: Do no crash if a requested resource is not available

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Before:
```
Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: Resource foo is not tracked in this resource set.
    at com.google.devtools.build.lib.actions.ResourceManager.assertExtraResourcesTracked(ResourceManager.java:499)
    at com.google.devtools.build.lib.actions.ResourceManager.areResourcesAvailable(ResourceManager.java:540)
```
After:
```
ERROR: src/test/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/actions/BUILD:102:10: Testing //src/test/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/actions:ActionsTests failed: Resource foo is not being tracked by the resource manager. Available resources are: cpu, memory
```

Fixes #19572

issue.title: [7.4.0] Do no crash if a requested resource is not available

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Before:
```
Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: Resource foo is not tracked in this resource set.
    at com.google.devtools.build.lib.actions.ResourceManager.assertExtraResourcesTracked(ResourceManager.java:499)
    at com.google.devtools.build.lib.actions.ResourceManager.areResourcesAvailable(ResourceManager.java:540)
```
After:
```
ERROR: src/test/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/actions/BUILD:102:10: Testing //src/test/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/actions:ActionsTests failed: Resource foo is not being tracked by the resource manager. Available resources are: cpu, memory
```

Fixes #19572

Closes #23541.

PiperOrigin-RevId: 682282327
Change-Id: Ifdff5f85de9e45ac119c2a2cfd161c054a722546 
(cherry picked from commit e5ab94bfdebb4a08b8849befbb40d7592485e4ee)

Closes #23868

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 7.4.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/7.4.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting `USE_BAZEL_VERSION=7.4.0rc1`. Thanks!
